title: Pierre-Vincent Claverie was awarded his Ph.D in 2004 from the Université de Paris I. He currently works in the French Parliament. title: Coureas studied ancient and medieval history at the University of London and currently works as a Senior Researcher at the Cyprus Research Centre in Nicosia, Cyprus. He has published numerous articles and several books on the history of Lusignan Cyprus, including two monographs titled The Latin Church in Cyprus 1195-1312 (Ashgate 1997) and The Latin Church in Cyprus 1313-1378

container-title: 1973 he was awarded the Prix Gustave Schlumberger of the Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-Lettres in Paris. His main fields of research and publication are intercultural exchange between the West and the Eastern Mediterranean from the 9th-15th centuries; silk production and trade in the Middle Ages; and the Jews in the medieval Mediterranean. His latest collections of studies are Commercial Exchange Across the Mediterranean: Byzantium
note: the Crusader Levant, Egypt and Italy (Aldershot, 2005); Latins, Greeks and Muslims: Encounters in the Eastern Mediterranean, Tenth-Fifteenth Centuries (Farnham, 2009).
